element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm generates two new layers, creating one surface area of estimated values from a series of exact values through the interpolation method of Universal Kriging.
The method is based on a previous spatial autocorrelation analysis of the variable through the theoretical veriograma. One characteristic of this method is that this is used when the estacionariedad de primer orden cannot be assumed and a marked tendency (tendencia) in the estimated mean value in different points (gradual tendency of data).
The variable for estimation is made up of two components, the tendency and the residual. First the tendency is shown through a polinomic function, calculating the averages of the weights of the points calculándose el promedio de los pesos de los puntos en el ámbito de la vecindad del valor que se va a estimar; eliminada la tendencia que rompia la asunción de estacionariedad, los residuales se convierten en estacionarios y sobre ellos se realiza el kriging. After the interpolated residues will be added to the tendency to calculate the estimated values.

element.name: FIELD
element.text: the field that contains the value for interpolation for each point.

element.name: DIST
element.text: the distance within which all are considered observation points (same unit as the layer). Only the points within the search radius are used which makes it convinient to use a minimum radius to be assured that sufficient number of points will be found around all the cells.

element.name: GRIDS
element.text: select the layers that will act as predictives.

element.name: MINPOINTS
element.text: the minimum number of points that will be used in the forecast. If there are less points near the cell than the minimum specified, this cell will recieve a no data value.

element.name: MAXPOINTS
element.text: the maximum number of points that will be used for the forecast.

element.name: MODEL
element.text: the semivariogram model that may be used: * Spherical * Exponential * Gaussian

element.name: NUGGET
element.text: the value in which the semivariogram model intersects with the y axis.

element.name: SILL
element.text: the value of the semivariogram for the range.

element.name: RANGE
element.text: the distance where no more spatial correlation exists.
